svg.content: <mxfile userAgent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/69.0.3497.100 Safari/537.36" version="9.1.8" editor="www.draw.io" type="device"><diagram id="f995344f-91a3-2a91-884c-60af8dc02b27" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.font: MYSQL DB works as a Cache store and stores news headlines. The cache gets invalidated every hour. The search results from the App are not cached.
Newsquirrel is powered by NewsAPI and feeds all the data that it needs to run
IFramely provides snippets of information for a url. this is primarily used by the quickview feature
A GraphQL Endpoint that works as a ORM layer for the MYSQL DB

PM2 is a production process manager for Node.js.
A PM2 Cluster runs multiple instances of the Apollo server and manages all the node process.

div.span: Apollo graphql servers are the brains of the Application server stack.They are responsible for fetching the data and managing the cache store.

div.font: The Front end application(React/Apollo client) is hosted by the NGINX and is the gateway to the Newsquirrel application
NGINX works here as a Proxy and HTTPS enabler for the API
